Class OrderRepository

java.lang.Object
OrderRepository
public class OrderRepository
extends java.lang.Object
Holds a list of all of the daily orders that have been made through time. Provides functionality for printing general order data, along with creating new orders for each day.

Since:
2019-10-12
Version:
1.0
Author:
Ryan Lisowski (ID: 00257796)

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    OrderRepository()
    Constructor that sets the current date to the actual date that the program is run, and creates a new arraylist for daily orders to be stored in.

  • Constructor Details

    • OrderRepository

      public OrderRepository()
      Constructor that sets the current date to the actual date that the program is run, and creates a new arraylist for daily orders to be stored in.

  • Method Details

    • getCurrentDate

      public java.time.LocalDate getCurrentDate()
      Gets the current date, which is initially set to the actual date that the program is executed on. The program does allow this date to be incremented for testing/simulation purposes.
      Returns:
      LocalDate The current simulation date for the application.

    • setCurrentDate

      public void setCurrentDate​(java.time.LocalDate currentDate)
      Sets the current date to the latest testing/simulation date.
      Parameters:
      currentDate - The current simulation date.

    • setOrderList

      public void setOrderList​(java.util.ArrayList<Order> orderList)
      Sets the list containing the daily order data.
      Parameters:
      orderList - The arraylist containing daily order data for the store.

    • getMIN_QUANTITY

      public int getMIN_QUANTITY()
      Gets the minimum quantity of stock that the store should carry.
      Returns:
      int The minimum quantity of stock that the store should carry.

    • updateOrder

      public void updateOrder​(java.util.ArrayList<Tool> toolList)
      Checks all tools in the inventory to ensure that their quantity is above a minimum threshold. An order is made, if not.
      Parameters:
      toolList - A list containing all tools in the inventory.

    • advanceToNextDay

      public void advanceToNextDay()
      Checks, through a helper method, if at least one daily order exists in the arraylist of daily orders. If so, another check determines whether the latest daily order is for the current date. If so, methods are called to update the inventory quantities with the order information, and then to generate the order text. The current (simulation) date is then incremented by one.
